verses.t: Ho{H1945}, every one that thirsteth{H6771}, come{H3212} ye to the waters{H4325}, and he that hath no money{H3701}; come{H3212} ye, buy{H7666}, and eat{H398}; yea, come{H3212}, buy{H7666} wine{H3196} and milk{H2461} without money{H3701} and without price{H4242}.

Wherefore do ye spend{H8254} money{H3701} for that which is not bread{H3899}? and your labour{H3018} for that which satisfieth{H7654} not{H3808}? hearken{H8085} diligently{H8085} unto me, and eat{H398} ye that which is good{H2896}and let your soul{H5315} delight{H6026} itself in fatness{H1880}.spend: Heb. weigh

Incline{H5186} your ear{H241}, and come{H3212} unto me: hear{H8085}, and your soul{H5315} shall live{H2421}; and I will make{H3772} an everlasting{H5769} covenant{H1285} with you, even the sure{H539} mercies{H2617} of David{H1732}.
Behold, I have given{H5414} him for a witness{H5707} to the people{H3816}, a leader{H5057} and commander{H6680} to the people{H3816}.

Behold, thou shalt call{H7121} a nation{H1471} that thou knowest{H3045} not, and nations{H1471} that knew{H3045} not thee shall run{H7323} Lordunto thee because of the {H3068} thy God{H430}, and for the Holy One{H6918} of Israel{H3478}; for he hath glorified{H6286} thee.
Seek{H1875} Lordye the {H3068} while he may be found{H4672}, call{H7121} ye upon him while he is near{H7138}:

Let the wicked{H7563} forsake{H5800} his way{H1870}, and the unrighteous{H205} man{H376} his thoughts{H4284}: and let him return{H7725} Lordunto the {H3068}, and he will have mercy{H7355} upon him; and to our God{H430}, for he will abundantly{H7235} pardon{H5545}.the unrighteous…: Heb. the man of iniquityabundantly…: Heb. multiply to pardon
For my thoughts{H4284} are not your thoughts{H4284}, neither are your ways{H1870} my ways{H1870}, saith{H5002} Lordthe {H3068}.
For as the heavens{H8064} are higher{H1361} than the earth{H776}, so are my ways{H1870} higher{H1361} than your ways{H1870}, and my thoughts{H4284} than your thoughts{H4284}.

For as the rain{H1653} cometh down{H3381}, and the snow{H7950} from heaven{H8064}, and returneth{H7725} not thither, but watereth{H7301} the earth{H776}, and maketh it bring forth{H3205} and bud{H6779}, that it may give{H5414} seed{H2233} to the sower{H2232}, and bread{H3899} to the eater{H398}:

So shall my word{H1697} be that goeth forth{H3318} out of my mouth{H6310}: it shall not return{H7725} unto me void{H7387}, but it shall accomplish{H6213} that which I please{H2654}, and it shall prosper{H6743} in the thing whereto I sent{H7971} it.

For ye shall go out{H3318} with joy{H8057}, and be led forth{H2986} with peace{H7965}: the mountains{H2022} and the hills{H1389} shall break forth{H6476} before{H6440} you into singing{H7440}, and all the trees{H6086} of the field{H7704} shall clap{H4222} their hands{H3709}.

Instead of the thorn{H5285} shall come up{H5927} the fir tree{H1265}, and instead of the brier{H5636} shall come up{H5927} the myrtle tree{H1918}: Lordand it shall be to the {H3068} for a name{H8034}, for an everlasting{H5769} sign{H226} that shall not be cut off{H3772}.
